intro: Myosotis texana, commonly known as the Texas forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the United States, specifically Texas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and along stream banks. It has hairy stems and leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Myosotis texana is a perennial herb that produces small, showy blossoms during the spring and early summer.
